Article Title: Indonesia fines Google $12.37 million, here’s why
Article Text:
Previous fines on Google

Indonesia's antitrust agency has announced that Google has been ordered to pay a fine of 202 billion rupiah ($12.37 million) for engaging in unfair business practices through its payment system services on the Google Play Store.According to a report by news agency Reuters, the investigation, launched in 2022, examined allegations that Google had abused its dominant market position by requiring Indonesian app developers to use Google Pay Billing .This system allegedly charged higher rates than other available payment options, with developers facing removal from the Play Store if they did not comply.Google has previously defended its practices, stating that it had implemented a system allowing developers to offer users an alternative billing option. However, the Indonesian regulator determined that the company's actions amounted to anticompetitive behavior, leading to the significant penalty.Google has faced multiple fines, including a €2.4 billion fine from India, the European Union and a large fine from Russia.The Competition Commission of India (CCI) fined Google Rs 1,337.76 crore for anti-competitive practices related to Android devices. The CCI imposed the penalty on October 20, 2022. Google paid the entire penalty. The CCI also imposed a penalty of Rs 936.44 crore on Google for abusing its dominant position with respect to its Play Store policies.In 2017, Google was fined 2.4 billion pounds (about Rs 26,172 crore) for abusing its market dominance by unfairly penalising a price comparison website, Foundem. Google was also ordered to pay to a UK couple named Shivaun and Adam Raff. The couple won a 15-year legal battle after Google pushed their price comparison website Foundem down in search results.Russia fined Google a large sum that's been described as “more than Earth's entire wealth”, acknowledging the fine’s symbolic significance.
Article Summary: Indonesia's antitrust agency has announced that Google has been ordered to pay a fine of 202 billion rupiah ($12.37 million) The investigation, launched in 2022, examined allegations that Google had abused its dominant market position. Google has faced multiple fines, including a €2.4 billion fine from India, the European Union and a large fine from Russia.

Article Title: 'Nothing is changing...', Facebook-parent Meta on fact-checking strategy globally
Article Text:
Meta ends fact-checking partnerships ahead of Donald Trump’s inauguration

Facebook-parent company Meta will continue employing third-party fact-checkers outside the US “for now,” even as it phases out the practice domestically, a senior executive from the company has said. In the US, Meta plans to replace its third-party fact-checking efforts with a community-driven “notes system.”Nicola Mendelsohn, Meta’s head of global business, made the announcement during an interview with Bloomberg at the World Economic Forum in Davos, saying that the company intends to evaluate the effectiveness of this change domestically before considering whether to implement similar shifts in other regions.“We’ll see how that goes as we move it out over the year,” Mendelsohn was quoted as saying.“So nothing [is] changing in the rest of the world at the moment, we are still working with those fact checkers around the world,” she added.The move aligns with CEO Mark Zuckerberg ’s recent remarks – which came days ahead of Donald Trump’s inauguration – on scaling back the nearly decade-old fact-checking program, originally established to combat viral hoaxes on the platform.Zuckerberg cited “too many mistakes” and complaints of unfair censorship as reasons for the shift. He even accused former COO Sheryl Sandberg for the "culture" in Facebook in a meeting with Trump's advisor Stephen Miller.As per a report in New York Times Zuckerberg blamed Sandberg for Facebook's inclusivity initiative, which saw employees embrace self-expression in the workplace. He also hinted that the new guidelines and layoffs will be initiated to “reset the company.”However, he acknowledged that applying this approach internationally would face additional challenges due to stricter regulatory environments, such as the European Union’s Digital Services Act . The Act mandates large platforms to actively combat deceptive political content and misinformation, with noncompliance risking significant penalties.
Article Summary: Facebook-parent company Meta will continue employing third-party fact-checkers outside the US “for now,” even as it phases out the practice domestically. In the US, Meta plans to replace its fact-checking efforts with a community-driven “notes system.”

Article Title: Telecom minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on allocating spectrum for satellite services: 'My job is to…'
Article Text:
Elon Musk-Reliance tussle over satellite spectrum

Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has defended the decision to allocate spectrum for satellite services, instead of auctioning it off, saying that he wants users to have as many choices as possible.“My job as telecoms minister is to make sure that you have as many choices as possible,” Scindia told news agency Reuters during an interview. Allocating the spectrum instead of auctioning aligns with the global trend.An administrative allocation has been met with opposition from Reliance Jio , which had advocated for an auction process. Led by billionaire Mukesh Ambani, the telco had expressed concerns that an administrative allocation would favor foreign players like Elon Musk's Starlink , potentially eroding its market share.Scindia, however, acknowledged the dynamic nature of technology, emphasizing the need for companies to continuously adapt and evolve.“Technology is never constant,” Scindia said in a reply when asked if there was merit in Reliance's concerns, adding that companies need to keep evolving.He noted that satellite-based services require a clear line of sight to the sky, rendering them unsuitable for indoor use, unlike terrestrial networks.India's telecom market, with over 942 million users, is a highly competitive landscape with Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea vying for the largest market share.India’s satellite broadband market is projected to reach $1.9 billion by 2030, according to Deloitte, making it an attractive market for players like Starlink, Amazon Kuiper, and other global players.As per Scindia, the Starlink and Amazon Kuiper's applications for a licence to launch satellite broadband services in the country are under review.

Article Title: The Brutalist editor reveals that makers used AI in the Golden Globe-winning film, There's nothing in the film using AI that hasn't been done before"
Article Text: The makers of " The Brutalist " have revealed their use of artificial intelligence to enhance Hungarian dialogue and create architectural imagery in the critically acclaimed film, just days before Oscar nominations are announced.Editor Dávid Jancsó disclosed that Ukrainian AI company Respeecher 's software was employed to refine the Hungarian pronunciation of stars Adrien Brody and Felicity Jones in the Golden Globe-winning film ."Most of their Hungarian dialogue has a part of me talking in there," Jancsó told RedShark News. "We were very careful about keeping their performances. It's mainly just replacing letters here and there."Director Brady Corbet detailed the specific scope of AI usage in response to industry attention. "Adrien and Felicity's performances are completely their own," Corbet said. "Innovative Respeecher technology was used in Hungarian language dialogue editing only, specifically to refine certain vowels and letters for accuracy. No English language was changed."The film, made on a $10 million budget, follows Hungarian-Jewish architect László Tóth (Brody) as he rebuilds his life in post-World War II America . Jancsó, a native Hungarian speaker, said the production first attempted traditional ADR with the actors before turning to AI solutions."If you're coming from the Anglo-Saxon world certain sounds can be particularly hard to grasp," Jancsó explained. "We wanted to perfect it so that not even locals will spot any difference."The revelation comes amid growing concern over AI use in filmmaking. However, Jancsó defended the decision: "It is controversial in the industry to talk about AI, but it shouldn't be. There's nothing in the film using AI that hasn't been done before. It just makes the process a lot faster."Corbet also clarified reports about AI-generated architectural drawings in the film's finale: "Judy Becker and her team did not use AI to create or render any of the buildings. All images were hand-drawn by artists."97th Oscars nominations will be announced Thursday, with "The Brutalist " expected to receive multiple nods.
Article Summary: "The Brutalist" used artificial intelligence to enhance Hungarian dialogue and create architectural imagery. Ukrainian AI company Respeecher's software was employed to refine the Hungarian pronunciation of stars Adrien Brody and Felicity Jones. The revelation comes amid growing concern over AI use in filmmaking.

Article Title: US President Donald Trump revokes Biden's AI safety order: What the original order said
Article Text:
What Biden’s AI order said



US President Donald Trump has revoked an executive order related to artificial intelligence (AI) passed by Joe Biden in 2023. Aimed at mitigating risks associated with AI, including threats to consumers, workers, and national security, the order mandated developers to conduct and share safety test results with the US government before releasing systems deemed potentially harmful to national security, the economy, or public health, under the guidelines of the Defense Production Act. In 2024, the Republican Party platform pledged to repeal the order, arguing that it stifles AI innovation and emphasised that “Republicans support AI development grounded in free speech and the promotion of human flourishing.”Trump began his first full day in office on January 21, following an inauguration that set a fundraising record of over $250 million. Shortly after taking the oath, he also signed executive orders addressing immigration, environmental policies, and government operations.The order also instructed agencies to establish standards for AI safety testing and address associated risks, including chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, and cybersecurity threats. Biden introduced the order as US lawmakers struggled to pass legislation to regulate AI development.Generative AI, which can produce text, images, and videos in response to prompts, has generated both excitement and concerns, particularly over its potential to displace jobs or cause other negative impacts.Last week, the US Commerce Department imposed new restrictions on AI chip and technology exports, facing criticism from industry leaders, including Nvidia.Separately, Biden issued another executive order last week to support the growing energy demands of advanced AI data centres. This order proposed the leasing of federal sites managed by the Defense and Energy departments. However, Trump has yet to repeal this order.Apart from this, Trump has also issued orders freezing government hiring and mandating federal employees return to full-time, in-person work. This move has sparked opposition from unions representing public sector workers.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump has revoked an executive order related to artificial intelligence. The order was passed by Joe Biden in 2023 and aimed at mitigating risks associated with AI. In 2024, the Republican Party platform pledged to repeal the order, arguing that it stifles AI innovation.

Donald Trump returned as the 47th President of the United States of America on Monday, January 20. Trump said in his inaugural address that under his administration “our sovereignty will be reclaimed. Our safety will be restored. The scales of justice will be rebalanced." “From this moment on,” he added, "America’s decline is over.”Trump started the day with a prayer service at St. John’s Episcopal Church. The Church service at St. John’s in Washington is a tradition for presidential inaugurations. He and his wife, Melania, were later greeted at the North Portico of the executive mansion by outgoing President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden for the customary tea and coffee reception.The biggest American tech leaders Facebook parent Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, Apple CEO Tim Cook, Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Tesla and Starlink CEO Elon Musk too were seen at the Church services. Interestingly, the CEOs of America's biggest technology companies sat together, almost next to the Trump family.In one of the pictures Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Tesla CEO are spotted looking at their smartphones.Little surprising for Google CEO to be using Pixel 9 series smartphone; but it seems Elon Musk has made peace with Apple teaming up with ChatGPT maker. The Tesla CEO was quite upset with the partnership between Apple and ChatGPT creator OpenAI. In a post to X, formerly Twitter, the Tesla CEO said he would ban Apple (AAPL) devices at his companies — which include SpaceX and X, among others — if the iPhone maker went ahead with its AI plans.If Apple “integrates OpenAI at the (operating system) level,” Musk said that would constitute “an unacceptable security violation.” He added that visitors “will have to check their Apple devices at the door, where they will be stored in a Faraday cage”. “Apple has no clue what’s actually going on once they hand your data over to OpenAI,” Musk said in a separate post. “They’re selling you down the river.”

Article Title: Gaurav Taneja told to shut down YouTube channel by Sharks on Shark Tank India: Aap ka...
Article Text:
Gaurav Taneja on Shark Tank India

Poll Do You Agree with the Sharks' Comments on YouTube Channel Shutdown? No, Their Remarks Were Unnecessary Yes, It Was Constructive Feedback

Gaurav Taneja , the popular YouTuber and fitness influencer known as Flying Beast recently appeared on the Shark Tank India Season 4 pitching his supplements brand, BeastLife . Taneja valued his company at Rs 100 crore and sought Rs 1 crore for a 1% stake. He pitched the brand’s success, claiming to earn a revenue of Rs 1 crore within the first hour of its launch. However, the Sharks were skeptical of the YouTuber’s dual-focus strategy, questioning its long-term sustainability and potential for growth.In a candid LinkedIn post after the episode aired, Taneja shared his reflections on the experience. “Shut down YouTube and go all in on one business. That’s the advice I got from some Sharks on Shark Tank India,” he wrote in the post. He further revealed that during the pitch, one of the sharks questioned him whether he will continue making videos for YouTube. To which he replied with a confident ‘Yes’.“He didn’t seem too happy with my response and remarked, 'Aap ka focus nahi hoga, aap waha se paise bana loge.'” he stated. “But to me, that felt like a risky move — one that could hurt more than help,” he added.Anupam Mittal questions Gaurav Taneja’s business modelIn the episode, now airing on SonyLIV, one of the sharks – Anupam Mittal can be seen questioning the social media influencer. He said “When I started, I was a lot like you. I thought of myself as a star, but when you think of yourself as a star, you think you’re infallible.”“You can’t allocate time in startups, you have to be there all the time. It’s not that I don’t trust you, but I trust in Indian entrepreneurship. They won’t let a part-timer like you win,” he further remarked.Gaurav Taneja raises doubts on Shark TankIn another LinkedIn post, Taneja alleged the diminishing impact of Shark Tank. He wrote: “We recently took BeastLife to Shark Tank India and it was a fantastic experience! Many tout the show as a tremendous branding tool—even if you don’t secure a deal, the exposure is priceless.Naturally, we anticipated a huge spike in website traffic, given the strong brand value and massive audience Shark Tank has built over four seasons. But here’s what the numbers revealed:🔹 Traffic on Rosier Foods launch day: 𝟰𝟬𝟴𝗞🔹 Traffic on BeastLife launch day: 𝟮𝟯𝟴𝗞🔹 Traffic on and after hashtag#SharkTank release day: 𝟮𝟮𝗞Surprisingly, the traffic from Shark Tank was even lower than the push from our own Instagram Stories!This raises an important question: Has the impact of Shark Tank diminished? Here are some possible reasons we considered:1️⃣ Shark Tank India might be losing popularity2️⃣ The show may gain traction once episodes are uploaded to YouTube (making it free to watch for a larger audience)3️⃣ Skipping a TV broadcast for Season 4 was a strategic misstepWhat do you think? Has the allure of Shark Tank waned, or is it just a matter of timing and platform shifts?”.
Article Summary: Gaurav Taneja, the popular YouTuber and fitness influencer known as Flying Beast, recently appeared on the Shark Tank India Season 4 pitching his supplements brand, BeastLife. He pitched the brand’s success, claiming to earn a revenue of Rs 1 crore within the first hour of its launch. The Sharks were skeptical of his dual-focus strategy.

Article Title: Magic Compose button disappears from Google Messages in latest Beta update
Article Text: The latest beta version of Google Messages (version 20250119_01_RC00) has caused the Magic Compose button to disappear for several users. This feature, which generates suggested replies based on the conversation context and past messages, has been a popular tool for quick and efficient texting.Users have reported that the Magic Compose button, typically represented by a message bubble with a corner AI sparkle, is no longer visible in the text field. However, the Magic Rewrite feature , which offers alternative styles like Remix, Shakespeare, Chill, Lyrical, Excited, and Formal, can still be accessed from the 'plus' menu.Google has acknowledged the issue and confirmed that it is likely a bug that will be addressed soon. In the meantime, users can toggle Magic Compose on or off in the settings under Settings > Suggestions > Magic Compose.Despite the missing button, the redesigned Google Messages text field, which is not yet widely rolled out to stable, has received positive feedback for its clean and user-friendly design. The best design so far places Magic Compose/Rewrite outside of the field as part of the Smart Replies row.Google Messages continues to roll out new features, including dual SIM RCS support and the ability to set custom photos for contacts. The company is working to resolve the Magic Compose issue promptly, ensuring users can continue to enjoy the full range of messaging features.

Article Title: Donald Trump orders 75-day delay on TikTok ban in the US
Article Text: In one of his first acts as newly inaugurated US President, Donald Trump has ordered a 75-day pause on enforcing a law that would effectively ban TikTok in the United States. The executive order, signed on January 21, 2025, delays the implementation of the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act, which took effect on January 19.The law, passed by Congress and signed by former President Joe Biden, aimed to prohibit the distribution and updating of TikTok due to concerns that the Chinese government could exploit the app to spy on Americans or covertly influence US public opinion through data collection and content manipulation. TikTok had shut down in the United States late Saturday as the deadline passed, leaving millions of dismayed users barred from the app.Trump, who had promised to move quickly to save TikTok from the ban, stated, "I guess I have a warm spot for TikTok that I didn't have originally, but I went on TikTok and I won young people," crediting the app for delivering him the youth vote in his election.Under the executive order, the attorney general must issue guidance implementing the pause and send letters to service providers confirming they won't face liability for continuing to host or update TikTok during this period. This clarification is crucial for companies like Apple and Google, which would otherwise be required to remove TikTok from their app stores and block updates, facing penalties of up to $5,000 per user if the app is accessed.The 75-day pause is intended to give the new administration time to "pursue a resolution that protects national security while saving a platform used by 170 million Americans," according to the order.
Article Summary: Donald Trump has ordered a 75-day pause on enforcing a law that would effectively ban TikTok in the United States. The executive order, signed on January 21, 2025, delays the implementation of the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act. The law, passed by Congress and signed by former President Joe Biden, aimed to prohibit the distribution of TikTok.

Article Title: Walmart gets 'complaint letter' on Dunzo founder Kabeer Biswas' appointment as Flipkart Minutes head
Article Text:
Dunzo's dive down the hill

US-based retail giant Walmart is reportedly looking into the appointment of Dunzo CEO and co-founder Kabeer Biswas as the head of its Indian subsidiary Flipkart’s quick-commerce segment, Flipkart Minutes . According to a report in The Morning Context, the scrutiny comes after some former employees of Dunzo sent an email to Walmart CEO Doug McMillon and Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy, among others. Biswas, who co-founded Dunzo in 2014, recently joined Walmart-owned Flipkart to head its recently launched quick commerce division, Flipkart Minutes.The Morning Context claims to have seen the email to this effect, sent by the Walmart's investigation team to some former employees of Dunzo. The email to Walmart and Flipkart CEO sent by Dunzo’s former employees express concern about the company “hiring a person with…criminal background”.Once a rising star in grocery delivery, Bengaluru-based hyperlocal delivery company Dunzo has been struggling since over a year now. Its cash burn to scale operations, coupled with an inability to raise additional equity, led to significant downsizing. The startup resorted to multiple rounds of layoffs as it struggled to raise funds to sustain operations.The company now faces complaints from ex-employees demanding unpaid dues. An Inc42 report recently claimed Biswas is dealing with legal challenges from vendors and employees after moving to Flipkart Minutes. Dunzo’s creditors have taken the company to the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) over unpaid dues. Earlier this month, some employees filed a police complaint against Biswas at Indiranagar Police Station, Bengaluru.Despite raising over $450 million, including $200 million from Reliance Retail in January 2022, Dunzo struggled to maintain its market position. Reliance’s $200-million bet on Dunzo in early 2022 was intended to bolster its quick commerce ambitions, but the partnership struggled to deliver returns. The startup has been trying to find a buyer for the company for several months.A potential investment from fintech PhonePe in Dunzo's merchant network business failed to materialise, with the deal’s collapse partly attributed to concerns from other investors about PhonePe's Walmart backing. Similarly, Flipkart’s offer to acquire the company hit a wall when investors opposed selling the Dunzo brand. Even Reliance Retail, which held a 26% stake in Dunzo, remained reluctant to infuse additional capital.
Article Summary: Walmart is reportedly looking into the appointment of Dunzo CEO and co-founder Kabeer Biswas as the head of its Indian subsidiary Flipkart’s quick-commerce segment. Biswas, who co-founded Dunzo in 2014, recently joined Walmart-owned Flip kart to head its recently launched quick commerce division, FlipkART Minutes. Some former employees of Dunzos sent an email to Walmart CEO Doug McMillon and Flipkarta CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy.

Article Title: TCS becomes second global IT giant to surpass $21 billion brand valuation
Article Text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has become the second global IT services brand with a brand valuation of $21.3 billion. The company shared a press release stating that its brand valuation grew 826% over the last 15 years. TCS valuation in 2010 was $2.3 billion. The company says that the sustained investments in innovation, customer satisfaction and strategic marketing initiatives for the growth are the key drivers boosting TCS brand value.David Haig, CEO and Chairman, Brand Finance, said, “At Brand finance, we have been tracking TCS for about two decades and I am continually impressed by how the company keeps innovating its business and projecting its brand on the global stage. Their consistent efforts have led them to a milestone year where they’ve become the second company in the industry to ever cross the landmark 20 billion mark in brand value. Congratulations to all the 600K TCSers who proudly carry their brand forward.”Abhinav Kumar, Chief Marketing Officer, Tata Consultancy Services, said, “As we kick off a new year in 2025 with the World Economic Forum at Davos, we are delighted to see our brand cross this major landmark and cement its position in the top tier of our industry. We have been a strategic partner to WEF for 15 years and in this period our brand has nearly grown ninefold in value and is known globally for being a leader in innovation, the ability to deliver the most complex technology work in the world, and in creating long term partnerships of value with our clients. My thanks to the hundreds of thousands of TCSers who proudly build and live this great brand every second. We are all in it for the long run.”TCS sponsors 14 major endurance running races worldwide, including: New York, London, Boston, Chicago, and now Sydney, engaging over 600,000 runners annually along with initiatives like the Future Athlete Project. The company has also partnered with Jaguar TCS Racing , which competes in the world’s first all-electric racing series, the ABB FIA Formula E World Championship.TCS said that it further distinguishes itself through thought leadership, undertaking in-depth research and producing studies in areas like artificial intelligence (AI) and electric vehicle (EV) markets. TCS’ AI for Business Study evaluates the impact of AI and showcases how it is being applied across sectors, while the TCS Future-Ready eMobility Study 2025 highlights trends shaping the future of transportation.
Article Summary: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has become the second global IT services brand with a brand valuation of $21.3 billion. The company says that the sustained investments in innovation, customer satisfaction and strategic marketing initiatives for the growth are the key drivers boosting TCS brand value.

Article Title: Chidambaram supports Narayana Murthy and L&T Chairman in work hours debate: They are qualified to speak about ‘longer’ hours of work
Article Text:
Chidambaram backs Murthy and Subrahmanyan on longer working hours



Historical context of work hours



The role of technology in productivity



Chidambaram on work-life balance: A personal journey of long hours and fulfillment



Cultural shift towards productivity



Also read |

|

|

|

Former Finance Minister P. Chidambaram has entered the ongoing debate on work hours, lending his support to Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy and L&T Chairperson SN Subrahmanyan . The discussion was sparked by their recent remarks advocating longer work hours as a means of enhancing productivity in India. While their statements have been polarizing, Chidambaram provides a nuanced perspective, emphasizing the importance of context and intent behind these remarks. He argues that the call for extended work hours is aimed at inspiring India’s aspirational youth to adopt a mindset conducive to national growth and prosperity.In October 2023, Narayana Murthy proposed that young Indians should work 70 hours a week, citing India’s low productivity compared to global standards. He urged the youth to adopt a mindset of hard work, stating, “This is my country; I want to work 70 hours a week.” Meanwhile, SN Subrahmanyan suggested a 90-hour workweek for his employees, expressing regret about not being able to include Sundays in the work schedule. While their statements sparked widespread debate, Chidambaram sees them as calls to action rather than mandates for all.Chidambaram provided historical insights, referencing the evolution of the eight-hour workday, which was first legislated in Germany in 1918. He noted that this norm primarily applies to industrial and desk workers performing repetitive tasks. However, many professions, such as farming, law, medicine, and scientific research, often exceed these traditional hours. Chidambaram emphasized that the discussion about work hours must consider the nature of work and its broader goals.The former finance minister also pointed out the transformative role of technology in shaping work norms. He highlighted how advancements in automation, robotics, and artificial intelligence could lead to shorter working hours without compromising productivity. Chidambaram believes that these innovations can redefine how work is structured, creating a balance between efficiency and individual well-being.Sharing his own experience, Chidambaram stated that his long working hours encompass diverse activities, including practising law, parliamentary responsibilities, writing, and public engagement. He emphasized that work-life balance is a personal discovery and expressed satisfaction with his own approach to managing it.Chidambaram interpreted Murthy and Subrahmanyan’s remarks as an effort to encourage cultural change. He believes their statements are not targeted at workers in repetitive roles but at the younger generation striving to build a prosperous nation. According to him, long hours of productive work are essential for transforming India from a developing country into a globally competitive economy.Chidambaram concluded that the controversy surrounding these remarks might serve a constructive purpose by provoking thought and discussion on productivity and work-life balance. He dismissed the notion that the comments were controversial, instead framing them as an opportunity for individuals to reassess their approach to work and national progress.
Article Summary: Former Finance Minister P. Chidambaram has entered the ongoing debate on work hours. He has lent his support to Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy and L&T Chairperson SN Subrahmanyan. The discussion was sparked by their recent remarks advocating longer work hours as a means of enhancing productivity in India. While their statements have been polarizing, Chid Ambaram provides a nuanced perspective.

Article Title: Donald Trump ends work from home for government employees; read the 'Return to In-person Work' memo
Article Text:
Trump signs series of executive orders

Here's the memo titled 'Return to In-person Work'

Heads of all departments and agencies in the executive branch of Government shall, as soon as practicable, take all necessary steps to terminate remote work arrangements and require employees to return to work in-person at their respective duty stations on a full-time basis, provided that the department and agency heads shall make exemptions they deem necessary.

This memorandum shall be implemented consistent with applicable law.

Companies that have ended work from home

US President Donald Trump begins his first full day in office Tuesday, January 21. Trump took over as 47th US President in an Inauguration ceremony that set fundraising record of $250 million and counting. Just hours after takin oath, Trump signed several executive orders on everything from immigration to the environment and culture wars.Donald Trump signed orders freezing government hiring as well as an order requiring federal workers to immediately return to full-time in-person work. In a memo, Trump asked federal workers return to the office full-time. The language in the statement is said to underscore the challenges that the new Trump administration is likely to face, given the strong opposition to ending remote work by unions representing public sector workers.Amazon, JP Morgan, Disney, Dell, Zoom, IBM< Tesla, Snapchat, Uber, Twitter, Starbucks and Walmart are among the private companies that have ended work from home completely in the US. Most of these companies have seen resentment from some employees over the return to office mandate.A memo from JPMorgan's operating committee stated that over half of its 316,000 global employees already work in the office full-time, and that "Now is the right time to solidify our full-time in-office approach" . "We think it is the best way to run the company," the executives wrote in the memo. Despite this justification, some JPMorgan staff expressed their displeasure with the directive on the company's intranet, citing concerns about increased commuting and childcare costs, as well as mental health and stress. Reportedly, the comment page was locked after more than 300 comments were posted within the first hour.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump asks federal workers return to the office full-time. Amazon, JP Morgan, Disney, Dell, Zoom, IBM, Tesla, Snapchat, Uber, Twitter, Starbucks and Walmart are among the private companies that have ended work from home completely in the US.

Article Title: The secret behind Elon Musk's success? Justine Musk says it's hard work and saying ‘No’ often
Article Text:
Elon Musk’s success secret: Saying 'no' often



Childhood instincts and the loss of "no"

|

|

|

Elon Musk, the visionary entrepreneur behind Tesla, SpaceX, and numerous other groundbreaking ventures, has often been a subject of fascination for his incredible work ethic and unrelenting ambition. During a TEDx talk, Justine Musk , Elon Musk 's ex-wife and the mother of his five children, shared profound insights into the personal philosophy that has driven his success. Drawing from her years of being close to him, she highlighted how the power of setting boundaries and saying "no" played a pivotal role in shaping his achievements.According to Justine Musk, Elon Musk’s ability to say "no" was central to his success. She emphasized that this practice allowed him to guard his time and energy, which are critical resources for any entrepreneur. By saying "no" to distractions and activities that did not align with his goals, Musk was able to focus entirely on his ambitious pursuits.In her talk, Justine presented an enlightening concept: "Behind every no is a deeper yes." This philosophy underscores the importance of prioritizing what truly matters and rejecting anything that detracts from those priorities. For Elon Musk, this deeper "yes" meant dedicating himself wholly to transformative projects like electric vehicles, space exploration, and clean energy solutions. Justine noted that this principle of intentionality reshaped her own understanding of boundaries, focus, and self-worth.Justine Musk reflected on how children naturally assert their autonomy by saying "no," but as people grow older, societal pressures often suppress this instinct. She argued that reclaiming the power of "no" is essential for achieving clarity and living a life aligned with one's intentions. This, she said, is a lesson many could learn from Elon Musk, who remains steadfast in his commitment to his priorities despite external demands.
Article Summary: Elon Musk’s ability to say "no" was central to his success, according to his ex- wife. She emphasized that this practice allowed him to guard his time and energy. "Behind every no is a deeper yes," Justine Musk said.

Article Title: Elon Musk to trolls on 'Nazi Salute': The “everyone is ...” attack is sooo tired

Elon Musk’s controversial hand gesture video

He then repeated the same heartfelt gesture toward the crowd behind him."My heart goes out to you. It is thanks to you that the future of civilization is assured," Musk repeated after the gesture.

Article Title: When Melania Trump’s cryptocurrency token wiped $5 billion from Donald Trump’s memecoin
Article Text: Donald Trump's cryptocurrency token dropped 38% in value on Friday after his wife Melania Trump launched her own competing digital coin, erasing $5 billion from the token's market capitalization just days before his presidential inauguration.The TRUMP token's price fell from $74.60 to $45.90 within 40 minutes of Melania Trump announcing her own MELANIA token, according to CoinMarketCap data. Meanwhile, the First Lady-elect's new cryptocurrency skyrocketed to a $6.14 billion market value within two hours of launch."It's time to celebrate everything we stand for: WINNING! Join my very special Trump Community," Donald Trump posted on social media on January 17, promoting his token. The marketing featured Trump with a raised fist alongside "FIGHT FIGHT FIGHT," referencing his response to an assassination attempt during a July political rally.Over 45,000 digital wallets have purchased the MELANIA token since its launch Thursday evening, though blockchain analytics platform Bubblemaps reported that nearly 90% of the token supply is held in a single wallet, contradicting the project's claimed distribution structure.Critics warn these politically-linked tokens could enable undue influence from special interests and foreign entities. "If people want to gamble, I don't really care," said Lee Reiners, a former Federal Reserve economist now at Duke University. "What I care about is when this crypto bubble bursts -- and it will burst -- it will end up impacting people across the economy even if they don't have direct investment in crypto."Supporters view the Trump memecoin as symbolic of the incoming president's pro-cryptocurrency stance, which contrasts with the perceived hostility of the outgoing Biden administration. Trump has pledged to implement crypto-friendly regulations and has appointed industry advocates to key government positions.The TRUMP token initially sold for $10 before surging to $70 by Sunday morning. The token's website claims 35% was distributed to the team, with other allocations for treasury, community, public sale and liquidity.
Article Summary: Donald Trump's Trump token fell from $74.60 to $45.90 within 40 minutes of his wife's launch. The MELANIA token skyrocketed to a $6.14 billion market value within two hours of launch. Critics warn these politically-linked tokens could enable undue influence.

Article Title: Niti Aayog, Nasscom foundation partner to digitally empower 1 lakh people
Article Text:
Training under the programme

Nasscom Foundation , in partnership with NITI Aayog , is digitally empowering one lakh lives in India’s Aspirational Blocks , it has announced. The initial phase of the initiative – aligned with the Pradhan Mantri Digital Saksharta Abhiyan – focuses on bridging the digital divide by providing digital literacy training and access to essential e-governance services across 60 Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTG) blocks.The program will expand to include all other aspirational blocks. By promoting digital inclusion, this initiative supports the government’s vision of Viksit Bharat, fostering inclusive growth and ensuring that no one is left behind in India’s digital transformation journey.It said that the programme is built on the success of Nasscom Foundation’s Aspirational Districts Programme launched in 2022 and focuses on bridging the digital divide across 55 aspirational districts across 23 states through Digital Resource Centres.According to the Tribal Development Report 2022, the literacy rate among PVTGs is just 47.7%, far below the national average of 77.3% which makes the scenario of digital growth extremely vital in these communities.To address this disparity, nasscom foundation has extended the initiative from aspirational districts to blocks by focusing on communities including women and youth between the ages of 12 and 60, equipping them with essential digital skills and resources to foster holistic growth and inclusion.The training encompasses foundational computer skills, cybersecurity, and effective internet usage, enabling participants to navigate the digital world. Community outreach campaigns are also a part of the initiative, raising awareness about the benefits of digital literacy and e-governance services while encouraging the adoption of digital tools.The programme enlists local community champions as master trainers and digital ambassadors to lead these efforts.
Article Summary: Nasscom Foundation, in partnership with NITI Aayog, is digitally empowering one lakh lives in India’s Aspirational Blocks. The initial phase of the initiative – aligned with the Pradhan Mantri Digital Saksharta Abhiyan – focuses on bridging the digital divide.

Article Title: YouTube, Facebook and X agrees to Europe’s new tech rules: Here’s what is next
Article Text:
Representative Image

What is the new code of conduct and what EU said about it



"In Europe there is no place for illegal hate, either offline or online. I welcome the stakeholders' commitment to a strengthened Code of conduct under the

Digital Services Act

(DSA).”

Major tech companies including Meta 's Facebook , Elon Musk's X (earlier Twitter), Google's YouTube and others have agreed to strengthen their efforts against online hate speech under an updated code of conduct that will be incorporated into the European Union’s (EU) tech rules. According to a report by the news agency Reuters, the European Commission has announced that these companies, along with other signatories to the voluntary code established in May 2016, have committed to taking further action to combat the spread of hate speech. Several other tech companies have also signed the voluntary code of conduct to combat online hate speech, including Dailymotion, Instagram, Jeuxvideo.com, LinkedIn, Microsoft-hosted consumer services, Snapchat, Rakuten Viber, TikTok and Twitch.Under the updated code, companies have committed to allowing not-for-profit or public organisations with expertise in illegal hate speech to oversee their handling of hate speech notices. They also agreed to review at least two-thirds of such notices within 24 hours.Additionally, the companies will implement measures, including the use of automated detection tools, to minimise hate speech on their platforms. These companies will also provide transparency on the role of recommendation systems and the organic and algorithmic reach of illegal content before its removal.The companies will also offer country-specific data, categorised by internal classifications of hate speech, such as race, ethnicity, religion, gender identity, or sexual orientation.In a statement to Reuters, EU tech commissioner Henna Virkkunen said:The DSA mandates that tech companies take stronger action against illegal and harmful content on their platforms. According to EU officials, adhering to the updated code could influence how regulators enforce the Act.
Article Summary: Major tech companies have agreed to strengthen their efforts against online hate speech under an updated code of conduct. The updated code will be incorporated into the European Union’s (EU) tech rules. Under the updated code, companies will allow not-for-profit or public organisations with expertise in illegal hate speech to oversee their handling of hate speech notices.

Article Title: Microsoft rebrands another ‘iconic’ product on Windows 11 as it pushes for AI
Article Text:
Microsoft 365 Copilot with AI

Microsoft has reportedly retired the iconic “Office” brand, rebranding its productivity suite – known as Microsoft 365 Office – to “Microsoft 365 Copilot.” This move may imply a shift in the company’s strategy that emphasises the growing importance of AI within its product ecosystem.The new branding, spotted by Windows Latest, will reportedly be reflected in a redesigned logo and user interface, with a prominent focus on Copilot features and a streamlined user experience. The new logo has "M365" badge atop the Copilot logo.The Copilot branding has been gradually introduced by Microsoft, suggesting the company’s commitment to AI-powered tools and services. This rebranding follows Microsoft's recent price increase for Microsoft 365 subscriptions, which the company justified by integrating Copilot into the base plan.Microsoft has previously hinted its aim to align the company’s branding with its focus on AI. The company has previously changed “MS Office” branding to Microsoft 365 Office.To support its AI-driven evolution, Microsoft has increased the subscription price for Microsoft 365 for the first time since its launch in 2013.Microsoft 365 subscribers will gain access to Copilot AI capabilities within applications like Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and OneNote. This includes AI-powered features for generating content, automating tasks, and enhancing productivity.Microsoft is also adding Microsoft Designer app that can edit images and create new ones using AI-powered tools.The company previously rebranded Bing Chat as Copilot in November 2023. The rebranding was announced at the Microsoft Ignite developers conference.
Article Summary: Microsoft has reportedly retired the iconic ‘Office’ brand. The company is rebranding its productivity suite as ‘Microsoft 365 Copilot’ This move may imply a shift in the company’s strategy that emphasises the growing importance of AI within its product ecosystem. The new branding will reportedly be reflected in a redesigned logo and user interface.

Article Title: China 'wakes up' to 'Made-in-India' iPhones with 'restrictions' on manufacturing partners
Article Text:
China denies restrictions

Trump factor behind the 'wake-up' call

China seems to be finally taking note of Apple and other technology and auto companies moving manufacturing/assembly to India and other parts of the world. According to a report in Bloomberg, China is making it harder for employees and specialised equipment needed for high-tech manufacturing in India and Southeast Asia to leave its borders. The report that quotes people familiar with the matter added that this is possibly an attempt to prevent companies from shifting production in anticipation of higher tariffs under US President-elect Donald Trump Sources familiar with the matter indicate that Beijing has informally advised regulatory agencies and local governments to limit technology transfers and equipment exports to these regions. The goal is to boost domestic production, mitigate potential job losses, and discourage foreign investors from leaving China if the US imposes new trade barriers.For example, Apple's primary assembly partner, Foxconn, has reportedly faced difficulties in deploying Chinese staff to its Indian factory and in receiving specialized machinery from China. While these issues haven't yet impacted production, they highlight the potential implications of these restrictions. Sources reportedly indicate that Apple's China-based equipment partners have faced increased scrutiny from Chinese government officials regarding shipments of equipment to India. Recent reports also claimed that Apple and Foxconn sought help from the Indian government regarding the same. Apple and Foxconn are said to have sought urgent help from the Indian government for assistance as specialized manufacturing equipment faces significant delays at Chinese ports, threatening to impact India's electronics manufacturing expansion plans.China's foreign ministry has stated that it treats all countries equally and welcomes enterprises from everywhere, denying any actions that harm other nations. However, reports suggest that Beijing is particularly concerned about Foxconn further diversifying its production away from China, given the company's significant workforce and its importance to local supply chains and employment.This trend of companies shifting production away from China, which began during Trump's first term, is expected to accelerate and potentially include more technology companies. The restrictions on tech equipment are also reportedly affecting the manufacturing of electric vehicles (EVs) and solar panels in India, impacting companies like BYD and Waaree Energies. Previous reports indicated that Beijing aimed to limit the transfer of advanced EV manufacturing technology and had advised automakers against investing in India.
Article Summary: China is making it harder for employees and specialised equipment needed for high-tech manufacturing in India and Southeast Asia to leave its borders. Beijing has informally advised regulatory agencies and local governments to limit technology transfers and equipment exports to these regions. The goal is to boost domestic production, mitigate potential job losses, and discourage foreign investors from leaving China if the US imposes new trade barriers.
